channel.title: Opportunities to Play! Games with Open Seats Available 2019/04/08 thru 2019/04/14
channel.description:
Hey folks!
In this post, we will highlight games for the upcoming week which have open seats and therefore the opportunity to add some more gaming fun to your week.
### [Exodus: What Comes After Hallelujah](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-L_3Y-IluUJg_DaBDQL2) [date=2019-04-08 time=14:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] → [date=2019-04-08 time=17:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] [Exodus](https://fadingroots.itch.io/exodus) is a game by Erika Shepherd about a road trip from hell to someplace else, of angels running from a fascist dystopia, making community as they go, trying to find something better. It uses Avery Alder's Belonging Outside Belonging system, as seen in Dream Askew/Dream Apart and is heavily inspired by Ezra Furman's Transangelic Exodus. It's a game rooted in a time, an autobiography and a plan and a dream and a fear all in one. Too many people, today, can imagine having to pick up one day and leave your life behind, to go on the run from a world that has no place for you. Exodus tells that story.
### [Crossroads Carnival](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-L_8IaJdNF16OqcTN64F) [date=2019-04-08 time=20:30:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] In 1930's Dustbowl America, a carnival is ground zero for the final war between good and evil. Play as supernatural sideshows who are trying to stop the encroaching darkness while clinging to what little humanity they have left. @Kate_Bullock's Crossroads Carnival is a powered by the apocalypse game of desperate souls beneath the midway lights striving to save a world that hates and fears them.
### [Love and Longing (Good Society)](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-Lb1hj4Xbk4U2h_rXND1) [date=2019-04-08 time=20:30:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] Good Society is a game that seeks to capture the heart and countenance of Jane Austen's works.
### [Slings & Arrows ](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LYU-ZQM-MQfTRSSaCGN)
[date=2019-04-09 time=18:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] → [date=2019-04-09 time=21:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] @Mikel_Matthews' Slings & Arrows is about theatre people and how the show they’re in seeps into their day jobs and personal lives.
### [Lacuna Part 1: The Creation of the Mystery and The Girl from Blue City](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LXpyAa8PjsUvy4KeW9q)
[date=2019-04-09 time=19:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] → [date=2019-04-09 time=22:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] Lacuna Part 1. The Creation of the Mystery and the Girl from Blue City is an experimental roleplaying game . . . and you’re part of the experiment whether you realize it or not.
### [Rhapsody of Blood](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LawtefiFEh0MxM-Qyfw)
[date=2019-04-09 time=19:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] → [date=2019-04-09 time=22:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] Using @Jay's Rhapsody of Blood, a Powered By The Apocalypse system, we’ll tell multi-generational tales in the vein of Castlevania, Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure, Bloodborne, and Dark Souls.
### [The Crimson Shadow of a Golden Cross playtest](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LaMx7yPssT1fWa8v5Le) [date=2019-04-09 time=19:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] → [date=2019-04-09 time=22:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] This game is set in an original setting based on the Gothic Horror genre. It is meant to tell stories of religious corruption, class struggle, cultural oppression and grey morality.
### [Afterlife Wandering Souls: The Wall of Thorns](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-L_r7W8rhXTQzfrDMQG-) [date=2019-04-10 time=14:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] → [date=2019-04-10 time=18:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] Afterlife: Wandering Souls is a strange fantasy game where you play a Wanderer—a traveler who passed from the world of the living into the world of the dead. With no memories of who you once were your goal is to discover truths about yourself—as hard as that may be.
### [Dungeon World: Beyond the Slave-Pit](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LamHeQSkYLOcoKlLogb) [date=2019-04-10 time=23:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] You’ve been enslaved by the evil lich Drazhu and his vicious minions, who have put you to work digging tunnels to expand Drazhu’s underground lair. Life sucks bad! What do you do?
### [Mecha Monthly: Armour Astir](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LYNb8Pv2ILEOMB-c6V5) [date=2019-04-11 time=14:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] → [date=2019-04-11 time=17:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] A high-fantasy take on mecha warfare, play as rebellious magicians, fighters, clerics, and forty-foot tall magical constructs called Astirs, caught up in the struggle against an Authority that seeks to control them.
### [Storm Riders: GRUNTS](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LZfurQn414vW4oNMo6J) [date=2019-04-11 time=20:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] When Freedom is threatened, when Liberty is under siege, when the forces of evil are knocking on your door, that's when the GRUNTS (General Reserve United Nations Tactical Squad) mobilize! A Gauntlet Comics presentation! We'll use @Michael_G_Barford's Storm Riders to recreate the adventures of Solomon Toys' massively popular 80s military action figures and the associated mega-hit afternoon cartoon (Look to GI Joe, MASK, and Green Plastic Army Men for inspiration).
### [Fire Ships at Midnight](https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LYJlbT_o63TXtmC33C8) [date=2019-04-13 time=21:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] → [date=2019-04-14 time=00:00:00 format="LLLL" timezone="America/New_York"] @Tylom’s Fire Ships at Midnight is a three-player GM-less game of doomed petty maritime backstabbing from Codex - Flame, currently available on [the Gauntlet website](https://www.gauntlet-rpg.com/codex.html) for free!

item.title: Opportunities to Play! Games with Open Seats Available 2019/04/08 thru 2019/04/14
item.dc:creator: @xaithegamer
item.description:
@xaithegamer wrote:

One of my players just had to drop session 3 of Black Hack: Tomb of the Serpent Kings. Join us as we do everything we can to avoid rolling dice! OSR fun.

https://gauntlet-hangouts.firebaseapp.com/event-detail/-LYPPFt7iTd4cKQ2dGuc

Read full topic

item.title: Opportunities to Play! Games with Open Seats Available 2019/04/08 thru 2019/04/14
item.dc:creator: @shane
item.description:
@shane wrote:

Hey folks!

In this post, we will highlight games for the upcoming week which have open seats and therefore the opportunity to add some more gaming fun to your week.

Exodus: What Comes After Hallelujah

Monday, April 8, 2019 6:00 PM → Monday, April 8, 2019 9:00 PM
Exodus is a game by Erika Shepherd about a road trip from hell to someplace else, of angels running from a fascist dystopia, making community as they go, trying to find something better. It uses Avery Alder’s Belonging Outside Belonging system, as seen in Dream Askew/Dream Apart and is heavily inspired by Ezra Furman’s Transangelic Exodus. It’s a game rooted in a time, an autobiography and a plan and a dream and a fear all in one. Too many people, today, can imagine having to pick up one day and leave your life behind, to go on the run from a world that has no place for you. Exodus tells that story.

Crossroads Carnival

Tuesday, April 9, 2019 12:30 AM
In 1930’s Dustbowl America, a carnival is ground zero for the final war between good and evil. Play as supernatural sideshows who are trying to stop the encroaching darkness while clinging to what little humanity they have left. @Kate_Bullock’s Crossroads Carnival is a powered by the apocalypse game of desperate souls beneath the midway lights striving to save a world that hates and fears them.

Love and Longing (Good Society)

Tuesday, April 9, 2019 12:30 AM
Good Society is a game that seeks to capture the heart and countenance of Jane Austen’s works.

Slings & Arrows

Tuesday, April 9, 2019 10:00 PM → Wednesday, April 10, 2019 1:00 AM
@Mikel_Matthews’ Slings & Arrows is about theatre people and how the show they’re in seeps into their day jobs and personal lives.

Lacuna Part 1: The Creation of the Mystery and The Girl from Blue City

Tuesday, April 9, 2019 11:00 PM → Wednesday, April 10, 2019 2:00 AM
Lacuna Part 1. The Creation of the Mystery and the Girl from Blue City is an experimental roleplaying game . . . and you’re part of the experiment whether you realize it or not.

Rhapsody of Blood

Tuesday, April 9, 2019 11:00 PM → Wednesday, April 10, 2019 2:00 AM
Using @Jay’s Rhapsody of Blood, a Powered By The Apocalypse system, we’ll tell multi-generational tales in the vein of Castlevania, Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure, Bloodborne, and Dark Souls.

The Crimson Shadow of a Golden Cross playtest

Tuesday, April 9, 2019 11:00 PM → Wednesday, April 10, 2019 2:00 AM
This game is set in an original setting based on the Gothic Horror genre. It is meant to tell stories of religious corruption, class struggle, cultural oppression and grey morality.

Afterlife Wandering Souls: The Wall of Thorns

Wednesday, April 10, 2019 6:00 PM → Wednesday, April 10, 2019 10:00 PM
Afterlife: Wandering Souls is a strange fantasy game where you play a Wanderer—a traveler who passed from the world of the living into the world of the dead. With no memories of who you once were your goal is to discover truths about yourself—as hard as that may be.

Dungeon World: Beyond the Slave-Pit

Thursday, April 11, 2019 3:00 AM
You’ve been enslaved by the evil lich Drazhu and his vicious minions, who have put you to work digging tunnels to expand Drazhu’s underground lair. Life sucks bad! What do you do?

Mecha Monthly: Armour Astir

Thursday, April 11, 2019 6:00 PM → Thursday, April 11, 2019 9:00 PM
A high-fantasy take on mecha warfare, play as rebellious magicians, fighters, clerics, and forty-foot tall magical constructs called Astirs, caught up in the struggle against an Authority that seeks to control them.

Storm Riders: GRUNTS

Friday, April 12, 2019 12:00 AM
When Freedom is threatened, when Liberty is under siege, when the forces of evil are knocking on your door, that’s when the GRUNTS (General Reserve United Nations Tactical Squad) mobilize! A Gauntlet Comics presentation! We’ll use @Michael_G_Barford’s Storm Riders to recreate the adventures of Solomon Toys’ massively popular 80s military action figures and the associated mega-hit afternoon cartoon (Look to GI Joe, MASK, and Green Plastic Army Men for inspiration).

Fire Ships at Midnight

Sunday, April 14, 2019 1:00 AM → Sunday, April 14, 2019 4:00 AM
@Tylom’s Fire Ships at Midnight is a three-player GM-less game of doomed petty maritime backstabbing from Codex - Flame, currently available on the Gauntlet website for free!
